com.solacesystems.solclientj.core.resource

Interface MutableTopic

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Destination, Subscription, Topic

    public interface MutableTopic
extends Topic
    Objects with the MutableTopic Interface represent a mutable solace topic. The Solace appliance delivers messages based on the topic. In the JavaRTO API, a MutableTopic can be either a Destination, Subscription or a Topic. A MutableTopic can be used in any method that takes either a Destination, Subscription or Topic as an argument. A MutableTopic may not be changed while inside an API call which means that MutableTopics are not thread safe. However, a MutableTopic may be re-used/changed at any other time. A MutableTopic cannot be temporary. In order to modify the contents, applications must call flip() or reset() on the byteBuffer, add content, then call flip() to set the position to the beginning of the topic and the limit to the end of the topic before passing the MutableTopic to any API that requires a Topic parameter. Calling Destination.getName() on a MutableTopic will always return null.

    MutableTopics must be created by using this Allocator:

    • Solclient.Allocator.newMutableTopic()
    NOTE: to avoid garbage collection, applications should not allocate a new MutableTopic for every use case. Instead applications should maintain as many MutableTopics as necessary in a pool and re-use them when needed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.nio.ByteBuffer getNameBuffer()
      Retrieves the reference of the nameBuffer in order to allow applications to modify contents of the nameBuffer directly.
